intro: Bilabrella falciformis, commonly known as the falciform bilabrella, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes species known for their medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
